title: Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, along with Dr. Giada Marino and Bruna Paroni, presented research on using Large Language Models to analyze political discourse in hyperpartisan Facebook groups. He also moderated a roundtable on data access for researchers under the Digital Services Act. The article details his participation in the International Seminar on Disinformation, Social Media, and Climate in Porto Alegre and his presentation on mapping polarization in Brazilian Facebook groups.
description: This article discusses Fabio Giglietto's participation in conferences in Brazil, where he presented research on using Large Language Models to analyze political discourse and moderated a roundtable on data access under the Digital Services Act. It highlights his work on disinformation and social media analysis, specifically mapping polarization in Brazilian Facebook groups.

title: All Articles – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: This page mentions a video recording of a talk by Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino, given in June 2023 at the Queensland University of Technology (QUT). The topic was using OpenAI models to identify the most salient topics circulated via Facebook links in the run-up to the Italian general elections.
description: This page mentions a talk given by Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino in June 2023 at QUT, discussing the use of OpenAI models to identify salient topics circulated via Facebook links in relation to the Italian general elections.

title: Fabio Giglietto - Festival Internazionale del Giornalismo
snippet: This page mentions Fabio Giglietto as a researcher at the Department of Communication Sciences, Humanities and International Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, where he teaches Social Media Analysis. It mentions his publications in journals such as Journal of Communication, Information, Communication and Society, Journal of Broadcasting and Electronic Media, Social Media + Society and International Journal of Communication.
description: This page on the Festival Internazionale del Giornalismo website profiles Fabio Giglietto, confirming his affiliation with the University of Urbino Carlo Bo and his expertise in social media analysis and digital communication.

title: Scientists around the world call to protect research on one of humanity's greatest short-term threats – Disinformation - Observatory on Information and Democracy
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, University of Urbino, Italy, is listed as one of the scientists who signed a call to protect research on disinformation.
description: The article lists Fabio Giglietto, University of Urbino, Italy, as one of the scientists who signed a call to protect research on disinformation.
